I've been involved in civil rights my whole career, period, period, period. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb14', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb14', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Period. So is Biden a racist? No. Does Cory or Kamala think he's a racist? No. Do they care that he's not a racist? No. Is it all about taking him out? Yes. Look everyone, even Spartacus knows what Joe actually meant, that he can work with anyone, even people who held terrible ideas. That's the point. Because, eventually, progress gets made and the proof is they aren't around anymore. But such truths don't matter. If there's one thing we can learn from the Dems and their media overlords, power lies in misinterpreting words in their very worst light. Meaning if I can twist what you say into something evil, you bet I will. That's why everything you say is magically taken out of context and recast as negative and awful. It's why jokes are taken as literal facts. And a patriotic message on a red hat is called hate speech. It's where voicing a need for a border makes you a Nazi because Nazis are now just historical conveniences. Thanks to the modern smear machine, anything you say can and will be used against you, not in the court of law, but in their own twisted court of public opinion. But I don't feel too bad for Joe. He did the very same thing when he smeared Trump in his campaign launch video. Remember that? And now Biden's own party is doing him in. It's no surprise. If the leftist wing can casually smear anyone, then karma is always a stench. Wanted to use the other word but I didn't. I said stench. In case you forgot, Joe has done this to other people. This is what he said about Republicans.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Unchain Wall Street. It's going to put you all back in chains. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb15', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb15', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So what's good for the goose is --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good for the gander.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know what a gander is?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a male goose.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a male goose, yes. We googled that. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Thoughts?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Remember -- when Biden said that, it was about Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan, so not too long ago, but it feels like a little bit of a lifetime ago. Joe Biden has basically been on a script since he launched his campaign. Like, there's not been a lot of interviews. Kept the press at little bit at bay. And it's been hard for the other Democrats to figure out how can we take him down. They're finding their moment, and you can bet that this is going to be a big topic next week. And he's got to keep answering things like this over and over again. His pitch for himself is that I am the experienced one, I have the temperament that you want, and I am a moderate deal cutter. That might work in a general election. But would it work with these other Democrats and the primary voters? I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK, Juan, two questions. It doesn't seem to me that Kamala or Cory are playing for Biden's V.P spot? Two, do you think that Biden's toast? Or do you think he could be able to withstand this?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know what the time frame as you mean -- do I think he wins the nomination?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it's too early to say, although the poll show consistent support particularly from black voters. So, I think a lot of this may be an effort to undermine his standing with black voters who associate him with President Obama. I think that affirms a point you made in the monologue. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } But I will say this, that this is a time of interesting racial discussions in the country. You have that white supremacist group outside the Trump rally, the other day you had hearings on reparations, president refuses to apologize for the Central Park Five --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why should he?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Which was terrible. Those people were found not guilty. He wanted the death penalty, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You think they're innocent?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Look, let's not get into that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Come on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I do think they're innocent. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I don't. I disagree.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because I think that forensic --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You brought it up, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I did and I'm speaking to you. OK. And then this weekend, the Democrats are in South Carolina where, again, a high percentage of the Democratic voters are black. So, to me, this is like the good and the bad Biden. I think it was terrible judgment on his part to use this as an example of how he works with people that he may have disagreements with. But Joe is 76. He's been around a long time. He had to work with segregationists. Now, I don't think this is any terrible sin. What's the big deal to me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. So, Jesse, this is the contradiction, it's a gaffe, but he was trying to prove a point, which is that I'm choosing the worse example to prove a point. That I can work with the worst example

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah. Remember, he cut his teeth in the good old boys club days in the Senate in the 70's and the 80's. The fact that he actually served in the Senate with segregationists shows you how long he's been in politics. The guy he's talking about, this guy Eastman from -- Eastman from Mississippi, the Democrat, was born in 1904. And so he gets in there in the early 70's, and he has to work with these people. And their positions on segregation, they ended up changing and growing and evolving -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Eastland?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. And a lot of these people in the Democrat Party at the end of their career saw the light and what is the right thing to do with segregation. And Joe was there for that. And Joe was a civil rights pioneer for that. But what the people are trying doing now are they're saying they're trying to impose like a 2019 morality on the reality of a 1972 America. And you can't do that. And I don't doubt the sincerity of Kamala or Cory, but it looks kind of opportunistic. It looks like a cheap shot. And as you said, this is going to be a fight for black voters in the Democrat Party. They make up 25 percent of Democrat primary voters. So it's no surprise that those two people are trying to peel away the black support. But I don't it's going to hurt him with black voters. He just got a slew of endorsements in South Carolina today. I think people trust Joe. He was the V.P. for the first black president. Second black president if you include Bill Clinton.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But Bill Clinton would. Emily, I have a theory that the Democrats have run out of Republicans to call racists, so they're returning to the people who invented it, the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yeah, that's a good theory. I think it will be interesting to see the level -- what outweighs what. So what is more important to the African-American community, the association with President Obama, that administration, or these kinds of gaffes. I think it does beg the question though, like in what world did that comment benefit the either African- American community or the 18 to 49-year-old demographic which he needs so desperately? And I think, if anything, it does continue to relay the fact that he's out of touch with current times even if you can argue why are we imposing today's morality on 1972 or 76, or whatever, because it's relevant. And quick secondary point, that I think it's really telling that his staffers are coming out after the fact and anonymously reporting to multiple news sources, ah, we're telling him not to say those gaffes and like, we're telling him not to say these things. Because, sure, it's self-preservation for them, but it's also telling that it's potentially a dysfunctional and maybe unhappy campaign.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Didn't Hillary praise Robert Byrd, clansman, use the N-word deep into his Senate career, and she didn't get hit like that. So it's interesting that Biden is the one getting hit here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Dominican Republic health officials now saying the death of several American tourists is, quote, fake news. We'll tell you why, next.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Fox News has now confirmed that an 11th person has died in the Dominican Republic. This comes as Dominican health officials lashed out at recent reports exposing the death of nearly a dozen American tourists while visiting their country. Officials calling it, quote, fake news and hysteria aimed at hurting the country's tourism. Meanwhile, the FBI is reportedly analyzing alcohol samples from at least one hotel mini bar from a popular resort in the country to see if tainted booze is to blame for a string of tourist deaths. OK. So you guys, government officials are using the hashtag be fair to D.R. to combat this, what they call as I've just said, hysteria. You can argue however one life is one life too many, and tourism makes up 17 percent of their economy. It's not like it's 99. So how do we respond to that? Greg? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I like that. The D.R. needs a D.R. Look, I don't think the Dominican Republic wants -- they shouldn't be the mayor from Jaws, you know. You want to be Roy Snyder. So it's like -- you don't want to diminish a problem, you want to solve the problem. And the media, I think, can help by shining a spotlight but they can hurt, because the early stages of all this -- nobody knows what's going on, so I sympathize with the Dominican Republic in that. It's not all hysteria as the lower third says, but there is some hysteria in this fog of war can make -- everybody is rearranging the words to different equations without actually getting at the truth. And I think “The Five” should go and do on location show at the D.R.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, lift the boycott.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Jesse has got to lift the boycott.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If it's all expenses paid, I'm in.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, but don't drink from the mini bar, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What a principle boycott.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: I got an ear infection the last time I was there from swimming - -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's it. Boycott the D.R.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I sympathize with them because a lot of stuff isn't true, but there is something there that they have to solve. They have to solve.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's their part of it. It's their responsibility.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't think they have been transparent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't think they've been clear with people about what's going on. So then, you know, it's like people then fill the void with rumors and supposition -- we all agree -- we've said on this show, you know, it's a small percentage of the total number of visitors that go to the Dominican Republic. So I don't think we've been unfair. But I do think - and I'm not speaking for, Jesse--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesse, has been--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: --rest of us. But I do think it's to me like - for example, on this David Ortiz shooting thing, now you not saying, "Oh, it wasn't David Ortiz. It was a target, I think. Are you guys covering something up here? That don't feel right to me. So - but it's to me it's like Malaysia and the missing plane. The answer is with the Malaysian government. I think, again, the Dominican government should not be to use your analogy. Should be more Roy Scheider and not the Mayor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I find it very distasteful that they're using a phrase like "Fake News". Just because you don't agree with something, that doesn't mean it's fake. Where did they get that from?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Really, really they're responsible of them. So as I've been saying, I believe this is a Caribbean inside job. This is tourism terrorism. Sabotage some would say. I looked up the numbers and what did I find? The DR brings in about 6.18 million international tourists a year. The #1 Caribbean tourist destination in the Caribbean. Close second Cuba and then fourth Puerto Rico. So main suspects, we know. No hear me out.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't want to hear you out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The guy from the agency in the DR actually said this. This was a tourism attack.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The PR - Puerto Rico, was just hit by a devastating storm, they're losing out on a lot of tourism dollars, suspect #1. Suspect #2, we have Cuba. Now as you know, Obama opened up that island. Then Trump came in and closed it, so that window has shrunk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thanks Obama.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They are desperate for dollars there. Those are my two main suspects. And we're going to keep this investigation open.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Obama--

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Oh, my god, its--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You left of Haiti.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they share a border with Haiti - also very alarming.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Are you serious?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, people are dying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, I know. But you are serious?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Dana, in the library Colonel Mustard would we get hyper or whatever, clearly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: With the mini bottle of Scott.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just wait till this plays out. You will see.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would be interested in who the PR firm is that they hired, it bet they're American and that would be fine. Right? I'm good. This is American jobs we're talking about. The other thing is, not only is the government - just take a little semblance of "We'll check it out - well check it out. We don't think there's a thing. But we'll check it". But instead it's just like--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There is denial.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: --and you had without one billionaire from down there saying it's actually Americans who cannot handle alcohol or all you can buffet.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Don't test us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: There is a total spectrum of response besides staunch denial and be fair to DR and absolutely not, and we'll check into it, and we're sorry for your loss.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're a lawyer. What do the families get? I mean what rights they have? What can they do with this government? Like if it was my - my relative died there, what can I do?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Well, it depends. First of all, they need the information that the government hasn't released - though - so then after that then we'll find out. But it basically has to do with whatever that method of death is. And there can certainly be civil suits against the resorts--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: --if there is some--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'm sorry Emily. They're telling me that we need to take Nancy Pelosi, the Speaker of the United States speaking right now.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: --Iranian attack on an American asset that is in doubt as to who motivated it in terms of was it officially sanctioned or a rogue attack. Whatever it is, it was Iranian. How we go forward from here has to be strategic and smart and close in alliance with our allies. We have common interests in the region. We know that the high tension wires are up there, and we must do everything we can not to escalate this situation, but also to make sure that our personnel in the region are safe.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And you're pushing for - if they were to launch a military action an AUMF that would be--

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: I think that one thing that I can say, and I am just talking generally. But in terms of what I can say about the meeting - because it was a classified meeting in terms of what we were told. But, on every occasion that we are engaged with the Administration in terms of our national security, we make it very clear that in order to get engaged in any military activities we must have a new Authorization of Use of Military Force, AUMF. That is clear in our Caucus. I think even among some Republicans, but I certainly do not speak for them, but also, with our Democratic colleagues in the United States Senate.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Madam Speaker, are you personally convinced, based on the intelligence you've seen, that this was an Iranian attack on an American asset, operating legally in international airspace?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Have you received any sort of response for your request for a second all-Member briefing?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: Well, they have said that they will do that, but the briefing we had this morning, for the time that I was there, they had increased the number of people who were in the meeting to be briefed and, therefore, they had decreased the level of information that they gave us. At one point, they then cleared the room, but by then I had - we had our gun safety event, that I had to be at. So, I don't know what they gave after I left. But it was well into the briefing. So, what will they give to a broader group? I don't know how much more than is in the public domain. But, nonetheless, we want to be current and we want the confirmation of it and, that is, that our Members of Congress who have to make decisions are fully briefed on what the prospects are and what the possibilities are and what the choices are.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Does the Administration agree that the AUMF does not provide a legal rationale for an attack on Iran?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: No, they didn't say anything. They didn't say yes. They didn't say no. We just made our statements.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Madam Speaker, you're talking about de-escalation, are you advocating a particular action to--

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: No. No, I don't know what array of options that the Department of Defense has given to the President. He knows, but he did not share that with us.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Speaker Pelosi, Senator McConnell said that the Administration reaction would be measured. Is that your -

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: I hope that's right, I hope that's right. And - we try to - look, there are three things to remember. We must - this is a dangerous situation. We're dealing with a country that is a bad actor in the region. We have no illusions about Iran in terms of their ballistic missile transfers, about who they support in the region and the rest. So, we have an untrustworthy adversary, A. The high-tension wires are up in the region for a lot of different reasons, some bilateral in the region, some multilateral in the region, some religious - whatever it is, the high-tension wires are up. And third, we must act in a way that does de-escalate and does not escalate the tensions and the situation there. And again, I come right back to where I began that phrase, we must be fully engaged with our allies as we go forward. I'm hopeful that you're right about what Senator McConnell said about what the President's response might be, but I have no idea. They may have had their own conversations, but that's - that would measured by what measure, we'll see. But it is--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Are you confident the White House will consult the Congress before taking any action in Iran?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: I cannot really predict what actions the White House will take. They did consult with us today or informed us. We had the opportunity to share our thoughts with the Administration. The President said we'll have more meetings like this. I don't know what the sequence of that would be. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. That was Speaker Nancy Pelosi. This is after the White House invited several members of Congress leaders - leadership on from both sides of the aisle to the White House Situation Room in which - in a meeting that the President participated in. Basically she's saying, she wants to continue to be fully briefed, remain fully engaged with our allies. The other thing, I think, is interesting she said, "We recognize, we are not dealing with a responsible adversary and we need to do everything in our power to deescalate. It's a dangerous high attention situation". But in situations like this, Jesse, I will just go to for a quick comment. That you can see bipartisanship, because this is when you're actually being attacked by an enemy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Iran is one of the few countries in the entire world that kind of brings Republicans and Democrats together on Capitol Hill when it comes to a threat. And she sounded hawkish for Nancy Pelosi. Obviously, we want to consult with our allies. We want to deescalate. We need congressional approval. But I thought that was a pretty strong statement from the Speaker and I think she articulated the threat that that Iran poses with ballistic missile transfers and the export of terrorism. But I know that there's - people understand that this is not going to lead to war. Gas prices are not going to go through the roof. The market was up today. I think you're going to see a slow response, a sharp response, and we'll turn the page.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Perhaps targeted. Juan, one of the things she did say there, and this has been a bone of contention on Capitol Hill. Since 2001 when the Authorization to Use Military Force was provided to then President George W. Bush, she's saying now, that she thinks that the administration needs to come to Congress to ask for another one. Republicans have, in general, been reluctant to do that. Do you think that will be something they try to deal with in the next couple weeks before the July 4th recess?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know that we have weeks. I think this is an urgent situation. So they're going to have to do something in short order. The problem is, I think both sides - it's not just Republicans or Democrats, are reluctant to say, "I signed on to this at a time when most the American public does not want war". So I thought Pelosi was highly responsible. I think she showed that we do have a united front here at a time when we have polarized politics in the United States. In terms of response, though, the options - and she said that they did not delineate in that meeting what the options are. Dana, earlier in this program you spoke about you know retaliating inside Iran. I think they may think - wait a minute--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: With cyber capability.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. What - but here's another option. Iran, because they are a player in terms of terrorism in that region, they have assets in Syria. We could take out their assets there. We could put flags on America - on ships that aren't American ships, put American flag and say if you attack that ship, well, then you really have crossed the line. We can, in other words, set the terms of engagement.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I think in United States we have a government where we try to be as open as possible, but of course, they can't tell us what all the options are. The President needs to preserve those for himself. We'll move on. We'll come right back. And we're going to have this for you. Humans have started growing horns on their skulls and your cellphone is to blame. The alarming study, next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We've heard the warnings before of how using your smartphone too much can cause health issues. Well wait until you hear this one. New research suggests that over using handheld devices is now causing humans to grow horns on their skulls. Yes, horns. According to the study, the frequent forward tilting of the head is causing younger people to develop horn like bone spurs on the back of their skulls just above your neck. I'm going to go to you my young friend. How you're feeling today?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Horny.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: One of the reasons I got that luxurious chair in my office, Greg--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That produces perfect erect posture like this, and I don't have to hunch and grow horns like you will in your cheap chair. I also have a solution to this issue. My assistant Johnny will be carrying around my phone now. I will not be hunching. I will be saying Johnny did I get any e-mails? He will then relay them to me and I will say you type this back and he will then punch the numbers. He will be the one growing horns and I will say--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So it's going to be he elites will be able to avoid the horns.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The elites will have - yes. Yes, they will have little phone minions, so they don't have to grow horns.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, Greg, you're always on the edge of tech and I want to ask you what you think about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, OK, before I - well, I think Dana - it was going to blow this part.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I have breaking news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I want to say this, we talk about our - we have a relationship with technology. I don't think it's a relationship anymore. I think it's a communion. I think that we have cyborged. Like - this - even though the phone isn't connected to us, we have all the knowledge ever in the world in our hand and it's changing us and we will evolve 50 - 500 - 50,000 years probably 50,000 - we will look different.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I thought the world was going to end in 12.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Only for a few people - perhaps you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I just want to reiterate your point, because I think it's not only that is changing us, but especially our children. I think children are growing up with this and its having some unintended consequences.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There in the front of this. I think it'll take a few more generations before they look like robots.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Before we continue - Dana head breaking news.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was breaking news. I had to look at reason.com every way so check it out. Robby Soave - right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Soave.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Robby Soave - Robby Soave.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Rico Suave--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. Now, that's a great way to remember it, Robby. OK. So he's just written a piece and saying that story about kids growing horns because of smartphone's is fake news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: --is a fake news. He says that actually the study wasn't saying that the posture is changing because of the phone, but that has been over a long period of time, including books and the way that you are was sitting at your desk. And he said, I perused the studies in question that most researchers offered educated guesses that new technology has something to do with it. But the underlying research does not show that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's what Robby Soave is saying. And I trust it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nope.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO

And it also just reminded me of "Shallow Hal" remember that where he had the tone--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: That tail, I mean?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I - and I spend a lot of money going out to Pilates, to make sure this is - I don't get one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, it releases that.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

At the Paris Air Show, this very week, a saddle like seat was introduced. But instead of sitting down, passengers would lean on a seat cushion that resembles a bike seat with their legs hanging down, sort of like when you're riding a horse. Legroom on most flights is only 31 inches. Now with the new seats, it would drop down to 23. So Emily, what about it? Would you do it?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm tiny, so I can fit like anywhere, so I would try anything if it was like a dare. But I don't want to, because I use the flights to sleep. I have to have enough space to like curl up and I don't think hanging like roller-coaster style sounds very cool.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But what if it's cheaper?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: No, it's not worth it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did you see that? Did you see that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Locking the window.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, talk to the hand. So you wouldn't say - you'd say no even if the last seat on the flight out of Seattle and you say no I'm not doing it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: I mean, like - I mean if - of course, like circumstance - if I had to, if like the whole world is (inaudible), no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. Can I do the fake news now? OK. This story comes around every year. It's like that 4-day work week story we do. And the four-day workweek never comes, because no one wants to go first. Nobody - no airline wants to go first with this, because it's so - the posture is so demoralizing when it's - when you're looking at other - it's going to actually have literal class warfare. First class, tourist class, and this is the steerage. Air travel provides the starkest example of inequality. You know that feeling you get when you walk past first - that feeling? That is the feeling that causes revolutions.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Especially if you are famous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You will now that one day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's the feeling behind most - that feeling is the envy that drives Marxism and Socialism.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, that's what - and that's why China - just to change subjects a little bit, I think, is worried about - they have created, because of not doing complete and total communism and having some capitalism - they've created a middle class of hundreds of millions of people. And now they have a little bit of money and now they're mad. Because the Chinese government could take it away from them at any time and there could be a revolution.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What do you think, Jesse, what happens when the accountants here find out about this? Well, I be like standing - I will be standing at the Amtrak cafe--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: At least your feet hit the ground. Mine won't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, my neither.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's true. Well, that's the thing. Like, so you can't even put a blanket on you. Blanket falls off, you can't watch “The Five” on TV, you can't put a tray up to put your little drink there. You're going to be so stiff, you're going to go to the bathroom just to sit down to be comfortable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But it's never going to happen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But would you take it, if it was the last flight out?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If it was the last flight, I had to be there, I would.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And if it was going to the DR for sure.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. "One More Thing" is up next. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Time now for "One More Thing". So if you are a cop, you are always on duty, even in Australia.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Check this out. A guy is holding a press conference and a man starts running away, and what does he do? Interrupts his own press conference and tackled him.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, that guy had been very, very rude to someone's daughter and appropriate, so he cuts the press conference short and basically goes low.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a rugby player--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, man, he's got to run for Mayor--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Former rugby player, Greg, you are right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you could tell.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Nice form.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Also I'm on "Tucker" tonight, defending my title against Emily Compagno, so tune in to the news quiz tonight at 8:00 o'clock. Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Have you been able to get this song out of your head? Listen.

utterances.speaker: JOHN RICH, AMERICAN SINGER-SONGWRITER
utterances.sentences: Shut up (shut up) about politics Ain't nothing but a big pile of dirty tricks I'm tired of all the fighting and the [EXPLETIVE] fits So shut up (shut up) about politics.

utterances.sentences: You know you love that song. We love that song. Guess what, America loves this song. So I always look at the USA Today graphics every day in the morning--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Easy to read, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Easy to read. And here, look at this--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We are - it says, "Top Music Downloads, #2", "Shut up about Politics" right there. So you can still get it. All proceeds go to Folds of Honor. We love that song. Also tomorrow on the country music note, Fox & Friends has their Summer Concert Series, tomorrow the Charlie Daniels band. You don't want to miss that. They are going to be on their tomorrow. It is the 40th anniversary of the song "The Devil Went Down To Georgia".

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I don't like it song.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a great song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. No, no, no very - I don't like devils in my music.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's all you like in your music, Greg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's all I got.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Animals are Great!"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: As you know I have a house, and I hired a pool boy, even though I don't have a pool.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: --my pool boy is being doing. He gets out there. He gets into my ice cream and he also wears my sunglasses. And I'm just absolutely disgusted. And so I don't know how long he's been doing this. But it really - I find it deeply offensive. Look at him. And that is why my friends--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Animals are Great!"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Fire the pool boy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. All right. So today is kind of a bitter sweet day here at “The Five.” One of our producers, Deb Cote, moving up to Dana Perino show, "The Daily Briefing".

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Moving up?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, moving up. And I got to tell you guys Deb's my producer, have been working with me for the past two years. Here we are at the 2018 Major League All-Star Game and here we are at Deb's farewell celebrations. Here is Deb with cupcakes from this show staff earlier today.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't get that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Deb has worked for Fox nearly 10 years. She worked on the Huckabee Show, Hannity, before THE FIVE. And I'm going to tell you, she really will be missed. She is terrific. So Deb best wishes and Dana, you lucky girl.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I won the prize. I won the prize.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You shouldn't be savaging up the shows, but OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, stop poaching the talent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, Emily.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: OK. First, real quick shout out to Jason Doyle, thanks for watching. And secondly, we all know that - remember the Rock of Ages musical (ph) in the start of the movie, whatever - how they - they weren't allowed to use Def Leppard's music. Because, Def Leppard, which is my favorite band - anything Greg - they refused to let them use the music, because they were like - we don't want to be lumped in with hairbands. It was so funny. But now they have - you go - you should read the New York Times article about it, because the funny quotes of all-time are on it from Joe Elliott. But basically limited edition, 10th Anniversary celebration of "Rock of Ages" on Broadway, I will obviously be going. I hope you guys--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm going too, so fun.

utterances.sentences: I knew the star who used to do "Red Eye", Constantine Maroulis.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Let's definitely go.
